howtoinvestfordummies.model

Interface InvestmentStrategies

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    StockInvestmentStrategies
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    InvestmentStrategiesModel, StockInvestmentStrategiesModel

    public interface InvestmentStrategies

    This interface is designed with an intention to helps users learn about how money could be invested using different options available in market. It allows user to create investment portfolios, try out buying and selling of different investment options, and other various investment strategies to see how they can grow (or shrink) their money with time.

    To start with any investment, user has to create a portfolio which can contain different investment entities. Different Investment Strategies may extend this interface to add respective investments in the portfolio created by the implementation of this class. For the first version, we have added StockInvestmentStrategies interface which is extending this Interface to expose features specific to Stock Investments.

    Apart from creating Portfolios, user can explore portfolios by viewing details of the same. User may either list all the existing portfolios, read composition of a desired portfolio or check investment cost and value of that portfolio for any given period.

    To start with any investment, user has to create a portfolio which can contain different investment entities. Different Investment Strategies may extend this interface to add respective investments in the portfolio created by the implementation of this class. For the first version, we have added StockInvestmentStrategies interface which is extending this Interface to expose features specific to Stock Investments.

    Apart from creating Portfolios, user can explore portfolios by viewing details of the same. User may either list all the existing portfolios, read composition of a desired portfolio or check investment cost and value of that portfolio for any given period.

    Changes in this interface:
    • getHighLevelInvestments: This method returns list of all types of High Level Investment Strategy fetched from InvestmentStrategyType
    • initiateHighLevelInvestment: Starts investment type for the specified transaction details. Depending upon what type of investment type is chosen by the user, the portfolio with those configuration would be created.

    • Method Detail

      • createPortfolio

        IPortfolio createPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolioName)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a new portfolio object for the provided portfolio name. User may provide suitable portfolio name serves the intend of keeping all relevant investment entities at same place. User has to provide a unique portfolio name which doesn't match with the existing one.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - unique value of the portfolio name in String.
        Returns:
        portfolio created by user of type IPortfolio.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - in case portfolio with the provided name is already present.

      • getPortfolios

        java.util.List<IPortfolio> getPortfolios()
        Returns list of portfolio objects created by the user. The implementation should ensure that the original portfolio data structure is not modified.
        Returns:
        collection of portfolios created by user of type IPortfolio.

      • viewPortfolio

        IPortfolio viewPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolioName)
        Provides a way for the user to check complete details of the portfolio for a given portfolio name.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - name of the portfolio for which user wants to check details.
        Returns:
        an object of type IPortfolio containing composition of the same.

      • checkPortfolioStatus

        java.lang.String checkPortfolioStatus(java.util.Date date,
                                      java.lang.String portfolioName)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        At any given time, user may want to check the status of investment belonging to any portfolio. This method ensures the comparison of user investment cost at portfolio level with its value for the provided date. The implementation should ensure that only valid date is provided in the input. In case the date provided is non-working date, closing price for the previous working day should be taken into consideration for evaluating current portfolio value.
        Parameters:
        date - for which portfolio needs to be checked.
        portfolioName - in String for which investment needs to be checked.
        Returns:
        portfolio Status represented as String.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case date is invalid or portfolio name is not found.

      • getHighLevelInvestments

        java.util.List<InvestmentStrategyType> getHighLevelInvestments()
        Returns list of all the types of Investment strategies supported by the application. Whenever a new Strategy needs to be added, a type needs to be configured in InvestmentStrategyType.
        Returns:
        list containing different investment strategies.

      • initiateHighLevelInvestment

        IPortfolio initiateHighLevelInvestment(Transaction transaction,
                                       InvestmentStrategyType type)
        Sets up high level investment strategy provided by which type needs to be initiated. For example, user may provide Dollar Cost averaging and this method should then create a portfolio configured for this strategy.
        Parameters:
        transaction - of type Transaction.
        type - in InvestmentStrategyType
        Returns:
        portfolio data containing configuration for High Level Investment.
